fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
Set an email address different than the Outgoing mail server email in the Project Notification Scheme
Send an email message to the Incoming mail server

*Expected Results:*
Issue is created and notification is sent by the different email address changed in the Project Notification scheme as mentioned [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Email+Notifications#ConfiguringEmailNotifications-emailaddressConfiguringaproject'semailaddress]

*Actual Results:*
Issue is created correctly, but notification is sent by the default address from the Outgoing mail server
fields.summary: Notification not being sent by email from the Project Notification scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34813].
  {panel}

h3. Overview
In the current mail handler system, if you uncheck the "Create Users" box, the system will silently ignore any incoming messages from unknown addresses. It would be beneficial to be able to configure a reply message to let the sender know that their ticket wasn't created.

h3. Our Use Case
We recently we rolled out new email addresses for a segment of our user-base. Since we're OnDemand, we can't use Crowd or integrate with our AD environment, so needed each profile to be touched individually to update the addresses, and there were enough users affected that we had to rely on the users to update their own. Unfortunately, users who failed to update their profile were not courteous enough to stop emailing our helpdesk, and each request got bounced by the system without informing the users that there was an issue.

h3. Additional Requirements
In addition to just a configurable email, we should be able to black or whitelist domains to reply to. This is important for people running web-accessible instances, since spam-bots and other undesirables will latch onto a reply and go nuts.
fields.summary: Allow Reply to Unknown Users for Mail Handlers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34812].
  {panel}

When exporting a search to excel in issue navigator, not all columns are exported.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# create a custom field
# make it available for two issue types (bug, improvement for instance)
# create some issues and populate this custom field
# now, perform a search on the issue navigator: 'project = X' for instance
# add the custom field as a column on the issue navigator
(i) make sure the column is being displayed
# export to excel (current fields / all fields)

h4. Expected behaviour 
custom field is exported as well

h4. Actual behaviour 
the custom field is not exported

h4. Workaround
# change the search on the issue navigator to include the issue types the custom field is available for: 'project = X AND issuetype = Bug'
# export to Excel (current fields) one more time. Now, the custom field is exported
fields.summary: Export to excel (current fields) does not show all columns present in the issue navigator
Pivotal Integration Plugin should update with JIRA ID

When trying to change the workflow status of an issue in the Atlassian Connector for Eclipse (3.2.1.v20130402), I get an error message

com.atlassian.jira.rest.client.RestClientException: data was not an array

I've been able to track it down to the "fixVersions" property which is apparently not passed along correctly:

{"errorMessages":[],"errors":{"fixVersions":"data was not an array"}}

I've attached the TCP stream dump from Wireshark.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34803].
  {panel}

As a Jira OnDemand admin I would like to customise fields in the Summary panel so that they better relate to the project space.

I have assigned values to a project's version ("Iteration 9", "Iteration 10", "Iteration 11"), but can't call them "Versions", because the developers of the software that this project applies to don't have versions as such. Instead developments are done in _Iterations_ only. In effect the iteration has become the version.

I was looking to rename field _Fix Version/s_ to _Assign to Iteration_, but it doesn't seem possible.

I previously logged this as [JST-74242|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-74242].
fields.summary: Have the ability to customise fields in the Summary panel

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34800].
  {panel}

This is an improvment suggestion regarding the settings in the field configuration.
We have many fields that are not used any more which mean that I have to hide a lot of fields when making my field configuration.
It would really help if it was possible to select several fields and perform the same operation "hide" for all of them instead of setting them one by one.

And it would be really useful to select if you want to display hidden fields or only see required fields with a filter function.
Kind regards,
Katarina

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34793].
  {panel}

Customers are commonly finding the difference between the IS EMPTY and != options in JQL to be confusing.

For example, if I do a search for issues where AnimalField != Cat will return results where AnimalField is set to Dog, but not where that field is empty. 

Essentially the != operator means this field has a value, but the value is not Cat.

Many customers find themselves expecting it to mean "Does not equal or is empty", they try to understand why this behaviour isn't working as expected and hit up the docs, which do say it, but kind of hidden away. Could we add a section to call this out a bit louder?

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching
fields.summary: Highlight the differences between IS EMPTY and != in JQL Advanced Searching Docs

fields.summary: Form view actions does not work.

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms 

On large instances (like SAC for example), the issue dropdown can take quite a while to load since it runs whatever query you currently have live in the session. Depending on your search the dropdown can be almost unusable.

h3. Proposed solution

I think we should reintroduce the design where it shows instantly with all the information it can display and has a spinner that gets replaced when the query summary comes back with the issue count in the current search (or perhaps not show the count at all!).

h3. Workaround
Run an empty search using the quick search - just put your cursor in there and hit enter
fields.summary: Issue dropdown is slow to open
Link comment with it's emitted state
Web Links fail with special characters or spaces in URLs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34777].
  {panel}

The Web Resource context page in the Developer documentation currently lists defined contexts for the Create Issue and View Issue pages (*jira.create.issue* and *jira.view.issue*, respectively):

* *[https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Web+Resource+Plugin+Module]*

However, if a custom field type requires JavaScript on both the Create and Edit screens, the *jira.general* context must be used instead, since there is no context for the Edit screen.

Please add a new context to complete the set.
fields.summary: Add Web Resource context for Edit Issue (jira.edit.issue)

fields.description:
In a dashboard, if a user creates a text gadget, and extends the frame size (to have more space to edit) too much, the control buttons of the widget become unreachable as they fall out of the screen display.

See screenshot for example.
fields.summary: Extending frame size of text gadget too much looses button reach

fields.description:
In some cases, it becomes impossible to set a Affects or Fix version; when the list of versions is too long.

How to reproduce:
- in a project versions admin page, create version 2.1.0, and many "2.1.0_X"-type versions (like 2.1.0_a, 2.1.0_b, ... 2.1.0_i, 2.1.0_j...)
- create an issue
- in the Affects/version field, type 2.1.0
-- as the system privileges the '_' char, only 2.1.0_x versions are displayed in the drop-down list at first, and not the simple 2.1.0 one
-- try to enter directly 2.1.0 (then Enter) => JIRA says that {color:red}*"Version with id '2.1.0' does not exist."*{color}

We need to type "2.1.0" + space twice to have the version really accepted.

This is a minor bug, but for project users who deal with dozens of issues a day, this becomes a major inconvenience over time...
fields.summary: Impossible to affect a version when list is too long
Allow custom Clone Issue screens

fields.description:
Hello,
our customer Bayerische Landesbank is currently testing and evaluating the Tempo Plugin Version: 7.3.2.1
on jira 5.0.2.

When you try to enter an actual work time (Action: Arbeitszeit buchen) for days where a plan time (Planzeit) was given then the popup dialog does not close proberly . The animation for being busy is displayed "forever".
When using the browser Back button and refreshing the timetable the last booking WAS DONE properly.

Entering actual times on fays without plan times works fine.
fields.summary: Tempo gets stuck when entering actual work time on Tasks with plan times

fields.description: See comment on JRA-34454 : {quote}I've noticed that Send Test Email also works when Disable Outgoing Email is enabled, and even when the -D JVM parameters in setenv.sh are uncommented{quote}
fields.summary: Test email still sends when mail is disabled

fields.description:
- Navigate to the Dashboard
- Click on Add Gadget
- Select the Assigned to Me gadget
- Click on the Finish button
- The Assigned to Me gadget is displayed on the Dashboard
- Select the relevant fields and preferrences
- Click on the Save button 
- The items assigned to me is listed on the gadget
- Click on one of the items in order to view the details of the item
- Note that the status of the item is Closed

BUG: The description on the gadget is: "Displays all unresolved issues assigned to me". The Assigned to Me gadget should therefore not display Closed Items
fields.summary: Assigned to me gadget displays closed issues

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# create a status
# call it in a filter, save it
# change the status name
RESULT is the filter will no longer work.

It's quite an easy fix, but still, if the system allows you to easily change a status name, it should not cause errors in the filter. It may lead to big mistakes and waste of time. Specially when you guarantee that it is possible to change status and then you find out you'll have to update all them filters that use it. And then, there is no easy way to know which filters were using that status, except going ono by one...you can see the mess I've done.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34763].
  {panel}

Need a easier way to include non-null values in jira

I tried raising my concern with my colleague (Sthanunathan for JSP-164449) , however my idea did not get conveyed correctly.

Given that Jira is used by functional tester who do not have to be masters in SQL I suggest that when JSQL gets a query like

select * from jiraissue where FixedVersion!= 'Version2.4.0';

-where FixedVersion can take in null values - jira should internally convert it to 

select * from jiraissue where isNull(FixedVersion,-1) != 'Version2.4.0';

I tried this

key in (RETT-2236, RETT-2595) AND isnull(fixversion,-1) != RETT-Backlog

And got the below exception:

Error in the JQL Query: 'isnull' is a reserved JQL word. You must surround it in quotation marks to use it in a query. (line 1, character 431)

I have a work around, as suggested by you, 
key in (RETT-2236, RETT-2595) AND (fixversion != RETT-Backlog OR fixVersion is EMPTY)

but the problem is that the user does not have the schema to always know whether its a null field OR not.

Hence what I request is:
If there is a query like this from the front end:
select * from jiraissue where FixedVersion!= 'Version2.4.0';

-where FixedVersion can take in null values - always convert it internally to 

select * from jiraissue where isNull(FixedVersion,-1) != 'Version2.4.0';
fields.summary: Need a easier way to include non-null values in jira

fields.description:
If you have modified the columns displayed in the sub-tasks section of an issue, the page renders in Google Chrome making impossible to modify the issue's position.

*Steps to reproduce:*

- You need to modify the {{jira.table.cols.subtasks}} property (_The columns to show when viewing sub-task issues in a table_) and add the description field or other fields that will make that section grow in width.
- Then when you have more than one sub-task, you can't use the UP and DOWN arrows to modify the position of sub-tasks in the list:

!Screen Shot 2013-09-11 at 11.32.35 AM.png|thumbnail!

If you open the Developer Tools, you can see that there is a {{<div>}} section causing the problem:

!Screen Shot 2013-09-11 at 11.33.01 AM.png|thumbnail!

*Expected behavior:*

The sub-tasks section should not be overlapped with the sidebar so users can use the UP and DOWN arrows to change the sub-task position.

*Workaround:*

- Reduce the fields chosen for {{jira.table.cols.subtasks}} on JIRA's Advanced Settings (_Administration > General Configuration > Advance Settings_). For more details, check this [knowledge base| https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=163939652] article explaining how to modify it.
- Use a different browser such as Firefox or Safari.
fields.summary: Modifying the position of a sub-task not working in Chrome with more columns

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34753].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
While creating an issue, and you mention a user in the issue's *description*, a notification for the mention is not sent out. The notification will only be sent out *if you mention the user after the issue is created*, but not during issue creation. 

In this screenshot [^Notification2.jpg], the notification is sent only after I have mentioned the user after the issue has been created. The first mention was not sent out.

*Steps to Replicate*
# Create an issue in a JIRA instance that has outgoing mail configured.
# In the description field while creating the issue, mention a user using the "@mention" function.
# Create the issue.

*Expected Result*
JIRA would send out a notification for issue creation as well as one to the user mentioned in the description.

*Actual Result*
JIRA sends out only a notification to confirm issue creation.
fields.summary: Mentioning users in the issue description on issue creation does not send out notifications

fields.description:
When disable the xsrf through the property in *jira.xsrf.enabled=false* in {{jira-config.properties}} according to [the page|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Form+Token+Handling], it doesn't stop the xsrf checking when using JIRA REST API. However, the property took effect when you try some operation in the form of the browser.
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
 # Set *jira.xsrf.enabled=false* in jira-config.properties
 # Startup JIRA
 # Double check the system info and verify that the property is pick up by JIRA
 # Try to run the following cURL command without the "X-Atlassian-Token: nocheck" header:
{code:java}
curl -D- -u admin:admin -X POST -F "file=@data.json" http://localhost:8605/rest/api/2/issue/TEST-10/attachments
{code}

 # The POST request will failed due to XSRF check:
{code:java}
HTTP/1.1 100 Continue

HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
X-AREQUESTID: 930x34x1
Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=A0C11B22160D0CD729FF185C4BD54513; Path=/; HttpOnly
X-Seraph-LoginReason: OK
Set-Cookie: atlassian.xsrf.token=BJIT-YH5P-D3D6-OSCL|f436cd5126041ca4a65e8fda582a808e2866a8f4|lin; Path=/
X-ASESSIONID: ill5f2
X-AUSERNAME: admin
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, no-transform
Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
Date: Wed, 11 Sep 2013 07:30:43 GMT

XSRF check failed
{code}

h3. Expected Result:

The POST request should work and attachment succesfully add to the issue as the XSRF check has been disabled in JIRA.
h3. Actual Result:

The POST request failed with 404 error due to XSRF check failed.
h3. Note:

The POST will works right after you add in the token header:
{code:java}
curl -D- -u admin:admin -X POST -H "X-Atlassian-Token: nocheck" -F "file=@data.json" http://localhost:8605/rest/api/2/issue/TEST-10/attachments
{code}
On recent versions of Jira the header should be {{X-Atlassian-Token: no-check}}
fields.summary: disable XSRF check property has no effect on REST API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34746].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When querying the {{rest/api/2/issue/issueKey}} endpoint, the {{worklog}} properly only includes the first twenty results - and this property does not support the usage of expansion or pagination, as outlined in the [REST API platform page|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/rest-apis/] documentation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with several worklog entries.
# Browse to {{http://localhost:8080/rest/api/2/issue/TEST-1?expand=worklog&maxResults=40}}

h3. Expected Results
The rest endpoint should return at most 40 results in the {{worklog}} section.

h3. Actual Results
The REST endpoint only returns the first 20 results in chronological order.

h3.Workaround
Use the {{/rest/api/2/issue/<issueKey>/worklog}} endpoint to list *all* worklogs for a given issue. Additional manipulation will be required by the REST consumer to sort or filter those results; as that endpoint does not support pagination either. Please see [JRASERVER-69308|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-69308] for more details.
fields.summary: The /rest/api/2/issue/<issueKey> endpoint does not respect pagination parameters

The Data was imported through the beta JSON importing interface, so I understand the desire, not to resolve this bug. 

However, shouldn't the behavior being when there is a subtask(via an issue link ) that if there isn't a sequence that a reorder be called (instead of outputting  an exception) ? 

(I also created an issue, because I couldn't find anything on this error, so hopefully, this will help anyone who runs into this in the future. )
fields.summary: Exception On Subtasks With out Sequences

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Before JIRA 6.1, only reporter or assignee would block removal of a user. In JIRA 6.1 and above, the delete user validation has been extended to check on the user's comment on issues. While this prevents orphaned comments in JIRA, it also prevents JIRA Administrators from deleting JIRA User accounts which are no longer needed.

!delete.png|thumbnail!

However, there is no way to unlink user's comment from every issue automatically and the only way to delete a user who has made comments, is to delete the comments. This process is very difficult without making unsupported changes in the JIRA database. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in as a JIRA Administrator
# Attempt to delete a user with comments from *Admin Cog* > *User Management*
# Observe Error showing user has existing comments.
# Unable to delete user until the comments for the user do not exist.

h3. Expected Results
There should at least be some method to 'tidy' up the Users in JIRA, otherwise as JIRA Instances age they will develop long lists of Inactive Users.

h3. Actual Results
No easy way in JIRA to delete users, or tidy up the list of Users in JIRA. 

h3. Notes
Potentially, 
- a tab could be used to shuffle off inactive users into a different User Interface?
- Have a way to make the user 'Invisible' in JIRA with a flag.

h3.Workaround 

[Deactivate the user instead|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Users#ManagingUsers-Deactivatingauser]
fields.summary: Not possible to delete user with comments

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Replicate:
# Navigate to *Administration » Project Roles*;
# Add a new Project Role 'user' to the existing project roles (Administrators, Developers, Users);
# Browse to *Projects » Roles (tab)*.

h3. Desired Behavior:
JIRA would not allow the project role to be created or it would display both of them.

h3. Actual Behavior:
JIRA allows the project role to be created, and hides the original project role from any screen, displaying only 'users'.

h3. Workaround:
* Rename the new project role.

\\
----
h3. *Suggested Resolution:*
Making Project Roles case insensitive, so it is not possible to create a project role with the same name of an existing one.
fields.summary: Missing Project Role due to Duplicate Name (differentiated by case)

fields.description:
This causes the *Project Template Plugin* to fail to be enabled during startup, and due to that:
* you won't be able to choose a project template when creating a project; 
* and the header menu does not show the drop-down options.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce:*
# Disable the *JIRA Workflow Sharing Plugin*;
# Restart JIRA;

h3. *Expected Behavior:*
The *JIRA Workflow Sharing Plugin* is disabled.

h3. *Actual Behavior:*
Both the *JIRA Workflow Sharing Plugin* and the *Project Templates Plugin* are disabled (the latter fails to be enabled during the startup). The following is shown in the logs:
{noformat:borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}
2013-09-09 12:18:59,810 Timer-4 WARN anonymous 737x32x1 1pkiai9 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1%0 /secure/SetupImport.jspa [internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor] Timeout occurred before finding service dependencies for [NonValidatingOsgiBundleXmlApplicationContext(bundle=com.atlassian.jira.plugins.project-templates-plugin, config=osgibundle:/META-INF/spring/*.xml)]
2013-09-09 12:18:59,813 Timer-4 ERROR anonymous 737x32x1 1pkiai9 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1%0 /secure/SetupImport.jspa [internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor] Unable to create application context for [com.atlassian.jira.plugins.project-templates-plugin], unsatisfied dependencies: Dependency on [(objectClass=com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflow.sharing.importer.component.WorkflowImporterFactory)] (from bean [&ci-jira-workflow-sharing-importer-factory]), Dependency on [(objectClass=com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflow.sharing.importer.component.WorkflowStatusHelper)] (from bean [&workflowStatusHelper])
org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextException: Application context initialization for 'com.atlassian.jira.plugins.project-templates-plugin' has timed out
        at org.springframework.osgi.extender.internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.timeout(DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.java:454)
        at org.springframework.osgi.extender.internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.access$000(DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.java:50)
        at org.springframework.osgi.extender.internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor$WatchDogTask.run(DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.java:105)
        at java.util.TimerThread.mainLoop(Timer.java:512)
        at java.util.TimerThread.run(Timer.java:462)
{noformat}

h3. Suggested Resolution:
Fix the *Project Templates Plugin* so it can still function when the workflow importers plugin is not available. Alternatively, not allow users to disable the *Workflow Sharing Plugin* if project templates depends on it.

h3. Workaround:
# Enable the *Workflow Sharing Plugin*;
# Restart JIRA.
fields.summary: Project Templates Plugin is dependent on the Workflow Sharing Plugin

fields.description:
0. Edit existing bug
1. Click to edit description + write text there
2. Cmd/ctrl + S (by mistake...) in Chrome...then press Esc to close the saving window.
3. Result: the long/edited description disappeared :|
fields.summary: Crome - edit description not saved

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34702].
  {panel}

It would be interesting to have JIRA automatically update a plugin license when the license has already expired.

Example steps
# JIRA checks plugin license has expired
# JIRA checks my.atlassian.com for any valid license of renewal
# JIRA updates the plugin license if valid license found
fields.summary: Automatically update to a valid license when license expired
Issue list column "summary" should optionally NOT display subtask's parent issue key

fields.description:
Editing the project name should prompt the user to establish a "secure admin session" (webusdo) if it has not been already established. 

This seems to not be working correctly.
fields.summary: Renaming a project should prompt for a secure administration session / websudo
NewLicenseEvent is not defined as a public class and hence unuseable as an event
Sorry please delete this
Ability to specify a a template for the branch name to create

fields.description:
Search for list of issues in JIRA
In the search results, click Status or Resolution or any other column to sort the results
Search results are not sorted.  
This is a pain when need to go navigate through issues.
fields.summary: Sorting in issue navigator does not work

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

- Create a new JQL filter in the Issue Navigator searching for all issues with the "Unresolved" resolution.
- Click on one of the issues in the results and "Resolve" this issue through the Detail View.

*Expected Behaviour:*
The issue should not appear in the left column anymore as it's not "Unresolved".

*Actual Behaviour:*

The issue is still in the left column (left side of the results) after the change.

!issueNavigator.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue Navigator is not refreshing after edit in the Detail View

fields.description:
When the Mail Handler fail to create an issue or add a comment dues to permission issues, the project referenced by the Mail Handler is listed by it's ID rather than by it's name. This is not user friendly as the ID is not displayed on the project page.  The Mail Handler should at least resolve the project Key or project Name.

The current email generated by the Mail Handler:
{quote}
This is an automated email from the issue creation service at "http://jira.mycompany.com".

An error was encountered whilst handling messages from the mail server
"jira@mycompany.com" using the handler "class com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateOrCommentHandler".

The error was:
------------------------
"User 'anonymous' does not have permission to comment on an issue in project '*10181*'."
------------------------

The error and the email that caused the error are attached to this email.

If this is a recurring problem, you may wish to contact a system administrator to check the parameters of your mail fetching service:

--
This message is automatically generated by JIRA.
If you think it was sent incorrectly, please contact your JIRA administrators
For more information on JIRA, see: http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira
{quote}

The expected email to be generated by the Mail Handler:
{quote}
This is an automated email from the issue creation service at "http://jira.mycompany.com".

An error was encountered whilst handling messages from the mail server
"jira@mycompany.com" using the handler "class com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateOrCommentHandler".

The error was:
------------------------
"User 'anonymous' does not have permission to comment on an issue in project '*My Project*'."
or
"User 'anonymous' does not have permission to comment on an issue in project '*MYP*'."
------------------------

The error and the email that caused the error are attached to this email.

If this is a recurring problem, you may wish to contact a system administrator to check the parameters of your mail fetching service:

--
This message is automatically generated by JIRA.
If you think it was sent incorrectly, please contact your JIRA administrators
For more information on JIRA, see: http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira
{quote}
fields.summary: Mail handler errors reference project by ID rather than name

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a user with upper case letters in a LDAP server (e.g. John)
# Connect this LDAP server to a JIRA 5.X
# Add a comment to any issue using the user created above
# Upgrade JIRA to 6.x

*Expected Results:*
JIRA should display the comment author display name as was displayed on the previous version

*Actual Results:*
JIRA displays the actual user name, instead of the display name

*Workaround*
You can change the comment author to match the new casing with the following update in the database
{code:SQL}
update jiraaction
set author = lower(author)
where author not in (select lower_user_name from cwd_user)
and lower(author) in (select lower_user_name from cwd_user)
{code}
If this does not find any rows to update, you are using a case insensitive collation and will need to change that first.

Please remember to always have a database backup before doing changes directly to the database
fields.summary: Comment author not being upgraded correctly when using upper cases in LDAP user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34688].
  {panel}

Jira currently only support a single domain.
With the introduction of the Enterprise level of subscription, the lack of multiple domains really damper the notion of Enterprise.

Jira should fully support multi domain within its project, add  a permission category "belong to domain" to restrict project to be only visible under a  domains or a domains group. Notifications should use the default domain assigned to a project.

Why? Here is a use case.

Company A use a public Jira to give their client a way to report issues.
The company grow and purchase company B, company C and company D, each having their own Jira.
Company A want to consolidate Jira, as their teams have merged. It would be counter productive to manage 5 instances of Jira, to have their customer to create account on 2 or 3 instance of Jira to follow ticket and to quintuple the hardware and database.

By having multiple domain, the company could merge the 5 jira into one, consolidate all the user into 1 instance and keep the domains associated to the merged company.

Customer from jira.companyC.com will still be able to access their project, not seeing the project from jira.companyB.com unless they acces it through the proper domain.

The users handling the request can also kept track of the domain, or with proper permissions, access all project from any domain.


THIS feature would give Jira Enterprise true enterprise level.

I hope this will remain open to allow people interested in this feature to vote for it.
Thanks
fields.summary: Alow Jira to support multiple domains with permissions

fields.description:
I have a problem when trying to deploy a downloaded Confluence instance in the step of connection to my existing JIRA instance. I found a similar problem in CONF-30480 at Atlassian's JIRA. It is set as cloned from CSP-107929 and when I try to access CSP-107929 my browser goes to a "Permission Violation" web page.

CONF-30480 tells me to authenticate in the line saying that it is cloned from CSP-107929 and so I do but, after clicking on the hyperlink to the latter I am sent to the same "Permission Violation" web page. 

Another evidence for this problem is that this description shows CONF-30480 as a hyperlink to the issue but this does not happen for the text CSP-107929.

We recently moved a story ticket to a different project. The subtasks followed, which was great. However, the Fix Version and Component of the subtasks were cleared out. 

Also, links to the old URLs for the subtasks do not redirect to the new URL. 

Everything works as expected for the parent ticket.

We did not find this problem when doing a bulk move where the parent and subtasks were explicitly selected. It was only when moving the single parent ticket where the subtasks followed.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34673].
  {panel}

Add Permission named "Ability to Edit Own Tickets" and rename "Ability to Edit Tickets" to "Ability to Edit All Tickets".

|| Was || Need ||
| Ability to Edit Tickets | Ability to Edit All Tickets |
| \- | Ability to Edit Own Tickets |

Do this in the way like it made with comments editing permissions.

In the current permission scheme of JIRA there is no possibility to doesn't allow to users/developers to modify tickets text that they did not created. It was not so trouble when tickets editing was only by clicking "EDIT" button (previous major versions of JIRA). But current version of JIRA (v6.x) is allowing to edit tickets just by clicking on the text (easy-to-use mode).

Also, there is no any needs to allow other developers to change a ticket that you had wrote. For example, permissions may be configured in the following way:
|| Permission || Groups/Roles/Users ||
| Ability to Edit All Tickets | jira-administrators, jira-managers, Project Lead |
| Ability to Edit Own Tickets | jira-users |
fields.summary: Add Permission named "Ability to Edit Own Tickets" and rename "Ability to Edit Tickets" to "Ability to Edit All Tickets"
